channel.title: Daily Paper Digest
channel.description: Algorithmically selected papers from 20+ journal feeds, focused on RF systems, cultural heritage conservation, and adjacent opportunities.

item.title: Wideband RF Radiance Field Modeling Using Frequency-embedded 3D Gaussian Splatting
item.description: Although 3D Gaussian Splatting (3DGS) techniques effectively reconstruct RF radiance fields at a single frequency, they cannot model fields at arbitrary or unknown frequencies across a wide range. Experimental results show that the proposed model trained on multiple frequencies achieves a Structural Similarity Index Measure (SSIM) of 0.922 for PAS reconstruction, surpassing state-of-the-art single-frequency 3DGS models with SSIM of 0.863. | Score: 5.59
item.author: Zechen Li, Lanqing Yang, Yiheng Bian, Hao Pan, Yongjian Fu, Yezhou Wang, Zhuxi Chen, Yi-Chao Chen, G

item.title: Snow Depth Estimation Based on STCTNet for Sentinel-1 and Multisource Data
item.description: The trained model was then used to predict the average SD for February from 2017 to 2022 at a spatial resolution of 20 m. The application of active microwave data and deep learning techniques in this study provides an approach that improves both the spatial resolution and estimation accuracy of SD. | Score: 5.54
item.author: Qing Cheng;Xinchen Xu;Linwei Yue;Weifeng Hao;

item.title: Training Signal Optimization for Behavioral Modeling and Digital Predistortion of RF Power Amplifiers
item.description: The signal is similar to orthogonal frequency-division multiplexing-based signal standards, facilitating its use in training during the regular operation of the wireless transmitter. Experimental validation of this method is also provided in hardware, with a PA using a 100-MHz bandwidth millimeter wave 5G signal. | Score: 5.27
item.author: Jonathan Guimaraes Ribeiro;Yiyue Jiang;Rahul Mushini;Miriam Leeser;John Dooley;

item.title: Adaptive Temperature-Driven Ternary Contrastive Autoencoder Framework for Hyperspectral Target Detection
item.description: Hyperspectral target detection (HTD) is a critical task in remote sensing, where numerous deep learning (DL)-based methods have emerged for their powerful ability to extract hierarchical and discriminative features. Experimental results on four real-world benchmark datasets demonstrate that our approach outperforms state-of-the-art methods in terms of detection performance and efficiency. | Score: 5.24
item.author: Jiaojiao Li;Hangyun Liu;Haitao Xu;Chengyuan Wang;Yunsong Li;Qian Du;

item.title: A Spike-Driven Transformer Network for Edge Computing-Based Partial Discharge Monitoring Using Ultrahigh Frequency Pulse Signals
item.description: To address these issues, this article develops a novel UHF monitoring system by combining a low-noise UHF sensing frontend and a spike-driven Transformer network toward edge computing, enabling a robust, energy-efficient and cost-effective PD recognition. Experimental results demonstrate the highest recognition accuracy, and reductions in computational complexity and energy consumption by 56.25% and 52.0%, respectively. | Score: 5.03
item.author: Changdong Wang;Jingli Yang;Yu’ang Li;Zhou Wang;Huamin Jie;Zhi Zheng;Zhenyu Zhao;Zhou Shu;Yongxin Guo

item.title: StylizedGS: Controllable Stylization for 3D Gaussian Splatting
item.description: Our method achieves high-quality stylization results characterized by faithful brushstrokes and geometric consistency with flexible controls. Extensive experiments across various scenes and styles demonstrate the effectiveness and efficiency of our method concerning both stylization quality and inference speed. | Score: 0.51
item.author: Dingxi Zhang;Yu-Jie Yuan;Zhuoxun Chen;Fang-Lue Zhang;Zhenliang He;Shiguang Shan;Lin Gao;

item.title: Despeckling of Synthetic Aperture Radar Images Using Linear–Angular Attention Transformer
item.description: In this study, we propose a linear–angular attention transformer network for SAR despeckling. Unlike models that rely on optical images for training and lack domain-specific features for real SAR despeckling, the proposed network is trained directly on SAR images in a self-supervised manner. | Score: 5.02
item.author: Souraja Kundu;M. K. Bhuyan;Karl F. MacDorman;Neeraj Kumar Sharma;Manish Bhatt;

item.title: GPR-OdomNet: Difference and Similarity-Driven Odometry Estimation Network for Ground Penetrating Radar-Based Localization
item.description: The experimental results show that our method consistently outperforms state-of-the-art counterparts in all tests. Specifically, our method achieves a root mean square error (RMSE), and achieves an overall weighted RMSE of 0.449 m across all data sets, which is a 10.2\% reduction in RMSE when compared to the best state-of-the-art method. | Score: 4.97
item.author: Huaichao Wang, Xuanxin Fan, Ji Liu, Haifeng Li, Dezhen Song

item.title: Generalizable Radio-Frequency Radiance Fields for Spatial Spectrum Synthesis
item.description: Unlike state-of-the-art methods that adapt vanilla Neural Radiance Fields (NeRF) to the RF domain with scene-specific training, GRaF generalizes across scenes to synthesize spectra. Experimental results demonstrate that GRaF outperforms existing methods on single-scene benchmarks and achieves state-of-the-art performance on unseen scene layouts. | Score: 4.62
item.author: Kang Yang, Yuning Chen, Wan Du

item.title: ULADiff: Unmixing-Guided Learnable Abundance-Latent Diffusion for Hyperspectral Image Denoising
item.description: Thus, how to effectively incorporate physical priors into the DDPM to improve denoising performance remains an underexplored issue. Comprehensive evaluations on synthetic and real-world datasets demonstrate that ULADiff outperforms state-of-the-art methods in both quantitative performance and visual fidelity. | Score: 4.13
item.author: Zhe-Min Wei;Heng-Chao Li;Yu-Bang Zheng;Jian-Li Wang;Qian Du;

item.title: U-SET: Uncertainty-Aware SAR-to-EO Translation
item.description: By leveraging the uncertainty estimation capabilities of deep-learning models, U-SET effectively prioritizes structurally complex and ambiguous regions during training. Comprehensive evaluations on our newly compiled KOMPSAT dataset demonstrate that U-SET achieves state-of-the-art performance, outperforming existing methods across six image quality metrics in both quantitative and qualitative assessments. | Score: 3.56
item.author: Minyoung Jeon;Hyun-Ho Kim;Juheon Park;Doochun Seo;Jaehyup Lee;

item.title: A WaveCluster-Based Robust and Fast Multibaseline InSAR Phase Unwrapping Algorithm
item.description: However, the MBPU methods still cannot effectively balance PU accuracy and efficiency when processing large-size interferograms. Theoretical analysis and experimental results show that this method has more advantages than the existing MBPU methods in efficiency, accuracy, and adaptability to baseline ratios when processing large-size interferograms. | Score: 3.52
item.author: Zhihui Yuan;Zhengguo Wang;Hanwen Yu;Xuemin Xing;Lifan Zhou;Lifu Chen;Junyi Xu;

item.title: Multiscale Integration of Spatially Dense InSAR Data and Temporally Intensive GNSS Data Enhances Landslide Displacement Prediction
item.description: Due to complex landslide dynamics and the lack of high-quality monitoring data, the timely and accurate prediction of landslide displacement remains challenging. These findings underscore the necessity and feasibility of multisource monitoring data in landslide displacement prediction, providing a robust and scalable framework for landslide disaster prevention. | Score: 3.46
item.author: Qianru Ding;Gang Ma;Chengqian Guo;Hua Chen;Fudong Chi;Wei Zhou;Xiaolin Chang;

item.title: MRI Super-Resolution with Deep Learning: A Comprehensive Survey
item.description: This survey reviews recent advances in MRI SR techniques, with a focus on deep learning (DL) approaches. Additionally, we provide a collection of essential open-access resources, tools, and tutorials, available on our GitHub: https://github.com/mkhateri/Awesome-MRI-Super-Resolution. IEEE keywords: MRI, Super-Resolution, Deep Learning, Computational Imaging, Inverse Problem, Survey. | Score: 3.31
item.author: Mohammad Khateri, Serge Vasylechko, Morteza Ghahremani, Liam Timms, Deniz Kocanaogullari, Simon K. W

item.title: Identification of nighttime urban flood inundation extent using deep learning
item.description:
Identification of nighttime urban flood inundation extent using deep learning
Jiaquan Wan, Xing Wang, Yannian Cheng, Cuiyan Zhang, Fengchang Xue, Tao Yang, Fei Tong, and Quan J. This research offers a practical solution for real-time flood monitoring, helping improve urban disaster response and management. | Score: 2.81
item.author: nan
